{"step_by_step_thinking": "Heart failure is a condition where the heart is unable to pump enough blood to meet the body's needs. Treatment for heart failure typically involves a combination of medications. Metoprolol is a beta-blocker commonly used in heart failure to reduce the workload on the heart. Trimetazidine is a medication used to improve myocardial metabolism and is sometimes used in heart failure. Sacubitril is a neprilysin inhibitor used in combination with valsartan for the treatment of heart failure with reduced ejection fraction. Nesiritide is a recombinant form of human B-type natriuretic peptide used in the treatment of acute decompensated heart failure.
